question:
In the last decade, there has been an increase in the number of variety of online courses available to adults. While welcomed as a great opportunity by many students, other student see these courses as a poor substitute for classroom teaching.

What are the advantages and disadvantages of studying an online course.
text: Nowadays, people can study using the internet without necessarily present in the classroom. This has become issue of debate among student. Some category of student sees it as a welcome development while others sees it as an ineffective way of learning. This essay will discuss the benefits as well as drawbacks of learning online.

On one the hand, online learning is beneficial because of its flexibility. Student can choose to attend classes at their convenient time. This will avail them time to attend to more pressing issues. More also, they can fix their exams when they feel like. This will enable them perform excellently well as they will most likely be extremely prepared both physically and mentally. In addition to this, online Learning makes learning less stressful. Lectures can be received at home or any place of choice irrespective of the location of the school and at any time of the day. This helps to bridge the gap that would have been created if it were to be a physical class.

On the other hand, there are some drawbacks associated with online learning. This includes the limitation to the type of courses that can be taken . For instance, practical related courses such as chemistry cannot be taken on the web. In addition to this, a student that studies on the internet cannot interact or brainstorm with other colleagues which make learning less interesting.
In conclusion, despite the drawbacks of internet learning, I think it is highly beneficial as one can achieve other personal goals alongside schooling because of its flexibility.
